answers.author: Maxwell Moline
answers.text:
Hi John,
Sacremento uses Maximo, and here is the link to the article about it: http://www.eponline.com/Articles/2010/03/02/Sacramento-Sewer-District-to-Use-IBM-Maximo-Software.aspx
Maximo provides a list of its partners, each of which has a list of their own clients;
WorkTech http://www.worktech.com/News/Customers.aspx provides to the following:
Anchorage, AK
Quebec
Barbados
Los Angeles, CA
Southern California
Minnesota
Onondaga County, NY
Pinellas County, FL
Seattle, WA
Asset Partners http://www.assetpartners.com/customers.html
Philadelphia, PA
Moricopa County, AZ
Sarasota County, FL
State of Alaska
Portland, OR
Jacksonville, FL
Washington, DC
Fort Worth, TX
Devonport, UK
Genesis Solutions http://www.genesissolutions.com/about-our-customers/customer-list/
Turlock, CA
Kendall County, CA
North Jersey, NJ
Regional Municipality of York
Chelan County, WA
Atlanta, GA
State of Michigan
Other companies such as Actuate, http://www.actuate.com/customers/customer-directory/ and Aquitas Solutions, http://www.aquitas-solutions.com/exp.asp also provide Maximo to certain cities. 
And here's a link to the Maximo users' group website: http://www.fmmug.org/index.php
I hope this helps!
Max

Corpus Christi uses it. Visit our site at CCtexas.com

author: John Harris
text: Is there any other Public Works using Maximo software to track Roads and Drainage maintenance?  Orange County FL. is just getting started with developing the platform and would like to align our development with at least two other Public Works so in the future we will be able to benchmark performance Apples to Apples.
title: Maximo
